articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Air India plane headed to London with 242 people on board crashed minutes after taking off from India's western city of Ahmedabad on Thursday, the airline and police said, without specifying whether there were any fatalities.
articles.title: Air India plane with 242 on board crashes at India's Ahmedabad airport

articles.author: Francois Murphy, Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Tehran announced counter-measures, as an Iranian official said a "friendly country" had warned it of a potential Israeli attack.
articles.title: UN nuclear watchdog says Iran in breach of obligations, Iran announces counter-measures

articles.author: Brad Brooks, Sandra Strojanovic
articles.description: California will face off with Washington in court on Thursday over President Donald Trump's deployment of U.S. troops in Los Angeles after demonstrators again took to the streets in major cities to protest Trump's immigration crackdown.
articles.title: Marines prepare for Los Angeles deployment as protests spread across US

articles.author: Julia Payne, John Irish
articles.description: Most countries in the Group of Seven nations are prepared to go it alone and lower the G7 price cap on Russian oil even if U.S. President Donald Trump decides to opt out, four sources familiar with the matter said.
articles.title: Most G7 members ready to lower Russian oil price cap without US

articles.author: Ahmed Rasheed, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: The United States is preparing to evacuate its Iraqi embassy due to heightened security risks in the region, three U.S. and two Iraqi sources said on Wednesday while a U.S. official said military dependents could also leave Bahrain.
articles.title: US preparing to evacuate embassy in Iraq over security risks, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: All of the Ukrainian troops need treatment, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said in a message on the Telegram messaging app.
articles.title: Ukraine and Russia exchange wounded, ill prisoners of war

articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel accused Hamas militants of killing five Palestinians who worked for the U.S-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation in an apparent effort to disrupt their food distribution operations.
articles.title: Humanitarian workers killed in Gaza bus ambush that Israel blames on Hamas

articles.author: Max Schwarz, Alexandra Schwarz-Goerlich
articles.description: Austrian investigators were on Thursday slowly piecing together the character of the man who carried out the country's worst school shooting this week, with officials struggling to reach anyone who knew the deceased 21-year-old well.
articles.title: Austrian investigators slowly build profile of school shooter

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 32 people were killed and dozens remain missing in Democratic Republic of Congo's Equateur Province after two boats carrying more than 100 passengers capsized in Lake Tumba, local authorities told Reuters on Thursday.
articles.title: At least 32 dead, dozens missing after boats capsize in Congo's Lake Tumba

articles.author: Ben Makori, Amanda Ferguson
articles.description: The violence began after two 14-year-old boys were accused of a sexual assault on a teenage girl.
articles.title: Northern Ireland leisure centre hosting immigrants attacked on third night of violence
